metadata.Title: CVE-2018-0495 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - low
metadata.Description:
Libgcrypt before 1.7.10 and 1.8.x before 1.8.3 allows a memory-cacheside-channel attack on ECDSA signatures that can be mitigated through theuse of blinding during the signing process in the _gcry_ecc_ecdsa_signfunction in cipher/ecc-ecdsa.c, aka the Return Of the Hidden Number Problemor ROHNP. To discover an ECDSA key, the attacker needs access to either thelocal machine or a different virtual machine on the same physical host.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-0495` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libgcrypt20 - 1.6.5-2ubuntu0.5
No subscription required

libssl1.0.0 - 1.0.2g-1ubuntu4.13
openssl - 1.0.2g-1ubuntu4.13
No subscription required

libnss3 - 2:3.28.4-0ubuntu0.16.04.4
libnss3-1d - 2:3.28.4-0ubuntu0.16.04.4
libnss3-nssdb - 2:3.28.4-0ubuntu0.16.04.4
libnss3-tools - 2:3.28.4-0ubuntu0.16.04.4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libgcrypt20 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.6.5-2ubuntu0.5').
openssl package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.0.2g-1ubuntu4.13').
nss package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:3.28.4-0ubuntu0.16.04.4').
